s-1.ptxt: TABLE OF BOLT, SCREW AND NUT

s2.ptxt: All bolts, screws, nuts and clips relevant to installing and removing the instrument panel are shown along with their alphabetical code in the table.

s-1.ptxt: PRECAUTION (w/ Airbag System)

atten3.ptxt: After turning the ignition switch off, waiting time may be required before disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal. Therefore, make sure to read the disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal notice before proceeding with work (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL (w/ Airbag System)

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to disable the SRS system.

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE UPPER INSTRUMENT PANEL SUB-ASSEMBLY
REMOVE CONSOLE BOX ASSEMBLY
REMOVE FRONT DOOR SCUFF PLATE LH

s2.ptxt: Put protective tape around the front door scuff plate.
Using a moulding remover, detach the 3 clips and 7 claws and remove the front door scuff plate.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR SCUFF PLATE RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE COWL SIDE TRIM BOARD LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the part of the front door opening trim attached to the cowl side trim board.
Remove the clip.
Detach the 2 clips and remove the cowl side trim board.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE COWL SIDE TRIM BOARD RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE RADIO TUNER OPENING COVER

s2.ptxt: Remove the 4 screws and radio tuner opening cover.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE INSTRUMENT PANEL HOLE COVER (w/o Multi-information Display)

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws <F>.
Disconnect the connectors and remove the instrument panel hole cover.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE ACCESSORY METER ASSEMBLY (w/ Multi-information Display)

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws.
Detach the 2 clips.
Disconnect the connector and remove the accessory meter.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 2 INSTRUMENT PANEL REGISTER BEZEL

s2.ptxt: Detach the 2 claws and remove the No. 2 instrument panel register bezel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE INSTRUMENT PANEL REGISTER BEZEL

s2.ptxt: Detach the 2 claws and remove the instrument panel register bezel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE GLOVE COMPARTMENT DOOR ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Slightly bend the upper part of the glove compartment door to release the 2 stoppers and open the glove compartment door until it is horizontal.
Pull the glove compartment door toward the rear of the vehicle to detach the 2 hinges and remove the glove compartment door.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 1 SWITCH HOLE BASE

s2.ptxt: Put protective tape around the No. 1 switch hole base.
Detach the 4 claws.
Disconnect the connector and remove the No. 1 switch hole base.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE AIR CONDITIONING CONTROL ASSEMBLY (for Manual Air Conditioning System)

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector and remove the air conditioning control assembly.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 3 HEATER TO REGISTER DUCT

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 clips.
Detach the 4 claws and remove the No. 3 heater to register duct.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE LOWER INSTRUMENT PANEL SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a clip remover, remove the 2 clips <A>.
Remove the 2 bolts <B>, 4 nuts <C>, screw <D> and 2 screws <E>.
Disconnect the hood lock control cable, fuel lid lock control cable, DLC3 and ash receptacle light.
Disconnect the connectors and detach the clamps.
Detach the 2 guides and remove the lower instrument panel.
for Automatic Air Conditioning System:
Disconnect the room temperature sensor.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE GLOVE COMPARTMENT DOOR LOCK ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws and glove compartment door lock.
